author: dlr
msg: On the merge-tracking branch: Incremental progress towards a conflict
resolution callback.
* subversion/include/svn_client.h
(svn_client_conflict_resolver_func_t): A new callback used in for
resolving merge conflicts during the application of a tree delta.
(svn_client_ctx_t): Add a svn_client_conflict_resolver_func_t field
at the end of this structure.  As this struct should be allocated
using svn_client_create_context(), this is a backwards compatible
change.
* subversion/libsvn_client/diff.c
(notification_receiver): Remove conflict handling stub code, which
was the right beginnings to the algorithm in the wrong location.
(default_conflict_resolver): Add callback function which conforms to
the svn_client_conflict_resolver_func_t API.  It currently is
implemented to immediately return an error.

author: dlr
msg: Refactor for modularization.  No functional change.
* tools/client-side/svn-graph.pl
(write_graph_descriptor): New function containing most of the
remaining logic scattered in the global namespace.

author: dlr
msg: Improve graphical representation of the repository family tree.
* tools/client-side/svn-graph.pl
Output solid blue graph with a white background.  Draw arrows
between nodes with a consistent line weight.

author: dlr
msg: * tools/client-side/svn-graph.pl
Add example of how to view graph output using 'dotty'.  Spruce up
TODO items, including a way to generate SVG output (still using
GraphViz).  Add some hints on how merge operations could be
displayed.

author: dlr
msg: Accept parameters on the command-line, rather than hard-coding them
into the script.  Misc. housekeeping.
* tools/client-side/svn-graph.pl
Bump copyright year.  Kill parameterization TODO item.  Add merge
history TODO item.  Use the Getopt::Std module.  Comment out print
to stderr.
($repos_url): Rename from $REPOS_URL.
(parse_commandline): New function which validates the command-line
arguments, and sets the global variables $repos_url, $youngest,
$startrev, and $startpath.
(process_revision): Replace double quotes with single where string
interpolation is unnecessary.  Comment out print to stderr.
